channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: China Is Risking a Deflationary Spiral
item.description: Wall Street economists are calling for more fiscal stimulus in the country. But Beijing may still not act boldly enough.

item.title: ‘He’s taunting me’: I loaned my son $30,000 to buy a house in 2012. I need it back. He says ‘the five-year window’ for repayment has closed. What can I do?
item.description: “I live off a modest pension and Social Security. I love my house, but it needs upgrading.”

item.title: China Fines PwC Over Evergrande's Onshore Unit
item.description: Chinese authorities fined PricewaterhouseCoopers nearly $108 million over lapses in its auditing of China Evergrande Group’s flagship onshore unit, He...

item.title: Investor sentiment dived in September. Here’s why it’s a good sign for stock bulls.
item.description: The AAII’s Bullish Sentiment survey can be a useful contrarian indicator says Bespoke

item.title: Your 529 College-Savings Plan Can Now Fund a Roth IRA
item.description: Parents with leftover money in college funds can now move them to retirement accounts—maybe even their own. But should they?

item.title: Say goodbye to the retirement ‘5.5% rule’
Berkshire Hathaway's Stock Is So Rich Even Berkshire Is Buying Less of It
item.description: Stock buybacks have slowed to a trickle. “If Buffett’s not buying his own stock, then why should we?” one investor asked.

item.title: A death cross looms for Micron’s stock, but this analyst says slower growth is a ‘temporary blip’
item.description: Micron Technology’s stock dropped Thursday, as investors grappled with a looming bearish technical signal and an analyst’s lowered earnings view.

item.title: Luxury Brands' New Snag? Handbag Arbitrage
item.description: It is much cheaper to buy designer goods in Europe than in China, and professional resellers are profiting from the gap. Posh labels are finding it ha...

item.title: ‘He called me a liar’: I inherited a $650,000 house from my grandparents, but my husband says I’ll never have any money when I’m older. Is he right?
item.description: “I plan to buy a second home as an investment property.”
